data.title: Strict operators
data.body:
Strict operators (===, !==, ins) could be useful in some cases.

``` GDScript
var v1 = Vector2(1, 2)
var v2 = Vector2(1, 2)
var a = [v1]
print(v1 == v2) # true, same content
print(v1 === v2) # false, different reference
print(v2 in a) # true, content contained
print(v2 ins a) # false, reference not contained
```

data.title: 1.1: critical: Materials are not saved with scene
data.body:
When using imported .obj, sometimes some elements can't have material set.
In editor everything looks good, but both running scene and reopenning of scene
shows materials missing. In case of FixedMaterial, it is not saved at all,
in case of ShaderMaterial Uniform parameter values are not saved with scene.
Saving Fixedmaterial works, but not with scene.

data.title: 3D mapping inside the editor
data.body:
This is a large feature request. Basically, this is a list of functionality needed in order to create maps for 3D games directly in the editor. This would be appreciated to appeal to Quake people who like mapping using tools like [GtkRadiant](https://icculus.org/gtkradiant/) or [TrenchBroom](http://kristianduske.com/trenchbroom/).

Many of these features (but not all) are already present in Add Primitives plugin.
## Shape creation
- Plane
- Cube
- Sphere, half-sphere with optional cap
- Extruded polygon with optional caps (with 3 to N sides, high polygon number makes a cylinder)
- Pyramid with optional cap (with 3 to N sides on bottom, high polygon number makes a cone)
- Torus

 
- CSG Substract
- CSG Merge
- Hollow selection (eg. to make a cube into a room)
- Ability to manipulate those shapes (interact with vertices, edges and faces) directly in the 3D view
- Clipper tool
## Texturing
- Set material on a specific face (to change texture of one face only)
## Helpers
- Selection: “Select inside”, “Select touching”
- Staircase generator

data.title: Add a way to change font size in editor without having to import a font
data.body: It would be easier to have an editor setting to change font size, without having to import your own font.

data.title: App crashes on android if java returns string array
Build options: "freetype" does not do anything on X11
data.body:
Building godot with `freetype=no` does not do anything, `FREETYPE_ENABLED` is still passed to the compiler [1].
I guess the freetype option should simply be removed from the SConstruct script [2].

[1] https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/1e382db/platform/x11/detect.py#L132-L133
[2] https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/1e382db/SConstruct#L106

data.title: Building with openssl=no stills links libssl
data.body:
Is this the intended behaviour?

I built export templates for x11 with `openssl=no`, but in the end I still get libssl and libcrypto linked:

```
g++ -o bin/godot.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal platform/x11/godot_x11.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.o platform/x11/context_gl_x11.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.o platform/x11/os_x11.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.o platform/x11/key_mapping_x11.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.o -L/usr/lib64 main/libmain.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.a modules/libmodules.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.a bin/tests/libtests.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.a drivers/libdrivers.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.a drivers/libdrivers0.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.a drivers/libdrivers1.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.a scene/libscene.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.a servers/libservers.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.a core/libcore.x11.opt.debug.64.minimal.a -lX11 -lXinerama -lXcursor -lssl -lcrypto -lfreetype -lpulse-simple -lpulse -lGL -lGLU -lpthread -lasound -lz
```

Here is the full build command:

```
scons -j3 target=release_debug platform=x11 bits=default tools=no gdscript=yes vorbis=no minizip=no squish=no theora=no use_theoraplayer_binary=no freetype=no speex=no xml=yes png=yes jpg=no webp=no dds=no pvr=no etc1=no builtin_zlib=yes openssl=no musepack=no disable_3d=yes disable_advanced_gui=yes extra_suffix=minimal pulseaudio=yes
```

data.title: Build failure with xml=no
data.body:
Investigating how to create lightweight export templates, I'm trying to build it with as little options as possible.

It looks like `xml=no` is not a viable option currently, as the build fails with:

```
g++ -o core/register_core_types.x11.opt.64.o -c -g2 -fomit-frame-pointer -DFREETYPE_ENABLED -DOPENGL_ENABLED -DGLEW_ENABLED -DALSA_ENABLED -DPULSEAUDIO_ENABLED -DX11_ENABLED -DUNIX_ENABLED -DGLES2_ENABLED -DGLES_OVER_GL -DPNG_ENABLED -D_3D_DISABLED -DGDSCRIPT_ENABLED -D_REENTRANT -Icore -Icore/math -Itools -Idrivers -I. -Iplatform/x11 -I/usr/include/freetype2 -I/usr/include/libpng16 -Icore/vorbis core/register_core_types.cpp
core/register_core_types.cpp: In function 'void register_core_types()':
core/register_core_types.cpp:104:2: error: 'resource_saver_xml' was not declared in this scope
  resource_saver_xml = memnew( ResourceFormatSaverXML );
  ^
core/register_core_types.cpp:106:2: error: 'resource_loader_xml' was not declared in this scope
  resource_loader_xml = memnew( ResourceFormatLoaderXML );
```

I started the build with:

```
scons -j3 target=release platform=x11 bits=64 tools=no vorbis=no minizip=no squish=no theora=no use_theoraplayer_binary=no freetype=no speex=no xml=no jpg=no webp=no dds=no pvr=no etc1=no openssl=no musepack=no disable_3d=yes
```

data.title: Default Input Map Actions work even if not activated
data.body: All of the default Input Map Actions work even if not activated. The only way to make them not working is to make them active ( tick them ), and remove all of the attached keys.

data.title: Camera2D margins don't consider zoom for calculations
data.body:
If the camera zoom is set to 1 for X and Y, the margins work as expected. That is, the camera stops scrolling right when it touches the margin.
However if the zoom is greater than 1 for X or Y, the camera will scroll past the right/bottom margin respectively. If the zoom is lower than 1, the camera will stop scrolling before reaching the right/bottom margins.

data.title: godot freezes if new navmesh is assigned
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Initially reported against 1.1rc2. Assigning a Navigation mesh to a NavigationMeshInstance freezes Godot. How to reproduce: Open the Navmesh Demo. Clear the Navmesh and create a new one. Godot no longer responds. 
ERROR: create: Condition ' !fc || ((fc%3) != 0) ' is true.
   At: core/math/triangle_mesh.cpp:102.
ERROR: mesh_add_surface: Condition ' array_len==0 ' is true.
   At: drivers/gles2/rasterizer_gles2.cpp:1804.
ERROR: add_surface: Condition ' len==0 ' is true.
   At: scene/resources/mesh.cpp:268.
ERROR: mesh_surface_set_material: Index p_surface out of size (mesh->surfaces.size()).
   At: drivers/gles2/rasterizer_gles2.cpp:2621.

data.title: Area2D does not report collisions with raycasts
data.body:
It seems that Area2D with a CollisionShape2D child do not report collisions when probed with 2D raycasts.
I create my raycast with:
`var raycast = get_world_2d().get_direct_space_state().intersect_ray(Vector2_origin, Vector2_end, exceptions_list)`

I've discussed it briefly with @reduz on IRC, and he said it might be a bug, hence this ticket.

Here is a minimal working example of this issue (made with 1.1rc2): http://remi.verschelde.fr/files/misc/area2d_raycasts.zip
The main scene contains a StaticBody2D that casts raycast upwards (at 130px). If you move it over the dirt line, it will report collisions with the tiles at the top of the map, who are StaticBody2Ds too. But it does not report collisions with the Area2D which is placed above it.

data.title: On change parent, the state from some nodes is lost
data.body:
**If I change the parent from a node with remove/add. I expect to continue with the same state.**
The worst and most notorious offender for this behaviour is animation player, for example: if the animation is playing x on second 10, on change parent, gets stuck at second 10 without autoplay, or on case of autoplay an animation, play this animation again.

It's seems that the ready event gets called on every add_child call, I don't know if this is supposed to happen all the time, and not only the first time where the node gets added to a tree.

I know i could detect the change parent on notify, save the animation state, and restore it, but that is like a patch and i don't know how many node types from godot follow this behavior and I need to patch it.

So we need someway to make the base nodes don't loss the state on reparent without adding code to the reparented node, included his subchildrens.

At first we need to clarify if ready should be called on all the add_child, and not only the first one.

For possible solutions I think:
- **Call the _ready() event only the first time and create another event for the old behavior like _on_enter_tree():** best option for me, this fix all the nodes without intervention, from the name of the event I expect this behavior, but could break some projects expecting the old behaviour, but I couldn't think a case where you need the old behaviour
- **Add a new optional parameter or method for add children which skips the ready event:** this option is the most clean and project friendly one, make a optional parameter like add_child(Node node, bool skip_ready == false) or a new method called like add_child_and_skip_ready(Node node)
- **Fix the behaviour for each node with problems from godot:** most time consuming option and could break some projects

Here is a project with the bug:
https://mega.co.nz/#!zcgxTBAa!_uC6-kA_Znuo21SPxHEi2JZ_rX3erNCNkrx0tb63hiE

More documentation of the issue and the project with the bug explained here:
http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1117#p9336
